Transcript:
Reva: What you're saying to me, Mama, in whatever voice it is you 
speak to me through. And I want to follow my heart and trust it, and I will. 
I'll try. Trust. Trust. This can't be. But it is. It's real. Mama, where am I?

What's happening? 
Regina: You're late. 
Josh: A.S. Alan Spaulding. How did Alan Spaulding's money clip end up

in our apartment? 
Olivia: He must have dropped it. 
Josh: When was he here? 
Olivia: He had... He had questions about the harbor project, and... I 
can't 
do this anymore. I can't do this. 
Josh: Do what? 
Olivia: I can't keep playing this game. You have to know the truth 
about 
Alan and me. 
Phillip: Beth? 
Lorelei: I found you. 
Edmund: Beth. 
Lorelei: I was so afraid that I would never see you again. 
Edmund: Darling, you've come back to me. 
Lorelei: Oh, Edmund, just hold me. 
Edmund: Oh, darling. Darling. 
Phillip: Beth. 
Edmund: Darling. Darling. 
Phillip: My God, are you all right? Where have you been? How did you

get here? 
Edmund: Don't... Don't bombard her with questions. All that matters is

she's alive and well right now. Tell me, darling. Tell me I'm not dreaming. 
Lorelei: Is this real enough for you? 
Edmund: Oh. Oh. Oh, my prayers have been answered. Now, let me take 
you someplace where you can be alone and rest. 
Lorelei: No, no, I'm fine. 
Phillip: Wait a minute. 
Edmund: Let's sit... 
Phillip: Wait a minute. Something is not right here.

[Commercial.]
Reva: Olivia. 
Regina: Who is Olivia? 
Reva: Who are you? 
Regina: Don't be impertinent. I'm Regina Robechaux. I'm the mistress of

this house. You may call me Madame Robechaux, or ma'am, if you must. 
Reva: Yes, ma'am. 
Regina: I assume they explained why you're here. 
Reva: They? 
Regina: The dispensary, where you work. 
Reva: Oh. Oh, I see. 
Regina: The new Orleans dispensary. 
Reva: New Orleans. 
Regina: Are you addled, woman? 
Reva: No. No. Uh, I think I'm just tired. 
Regina: Oh. Well, yes, I can imagine. Ever since those damned Yankees

took over, everything's been at sixes and sevens. It's wonder I even got a 
nurse during wartime. 
Reva: Wartime? 
Regina: Please, don't repeat everything I say. It's most annoying to 
us. 
Reva: But I don't want to be annoying, ma'am. 
Regina: Well, I can't go on calling you nurse. What's your name? 
Reva: My... Reva. Reva Shayne. 
Regina: Interesting. 
Reva: Oh, it's a family name. 
Regina: No, I meant your necklace. 
Reva: Oh, my mother gave this to me. 
Regina: Oh. Well, I like it very much. I assume you know why you're 
here? 
Reva: Maybe you should give my instructions to me. 
Regina: Yes. My husband was wounded in battle, and he needs expert 
care so he doesn't lose a limb to that dreadful gangrene. 
Reva: So I'm to change his bandages and make sure everything's sterile

and give him antibiotics? 
Regina: Anti-what? 
Reva: Plenty of fluids so that he can replenish any blood that he might

have lost. 
Regina: Well, do everything you can. My husband is most dear to me. 
Reva: I understand. 
Regina: I'll go get him for you. 
Reva: New Orleans. Damn Yankees. Wartime. This can't be. (Gasps) (gasps) 
Josh: So you've not been telling me the truth about you and Alan. 
Olivia: He was very angry that we brought in new investors for the 
harbor 
project. 
Josh: But he said... 
Olivia: He said that to save face, but he made it really clear to me 
that in 
private was going to raise a big stink about it. 
Josh: Why didn't you want me here to back you up? 
Olivia: Because... Because it was my idea to expand the investment pool

and... I got us into this mess, Josh; I want to get us out of it. And I did... I

knew he wouldn't take a slug at me, but you, you know. And I don't want to 
see that headline, "Josh Lewis maims head of Spaulding empire." 
Josh: I might have done that. 
Olivia: Yeah. Yeah, there's just so much bad blood between the two of

you, and I want to get through this project without spilling any of it. Besides,

I've always been very good at using my feminine wiles. 
Josh: Don't even joke about that. Olivia, it's demeaning. You can hold

your own against any man in a business meeting without that. 
Olivia: You know I... You have to know how much it means to me that 
you believe in me so much. 
Josh: Don't do that. Don't do that either. Don't handle me. 
Olivia: I was trying to handle Alan. You're right. I mean, you're 
right. If 
you have that much confidence in me, I should at least have that much 
confidence in you that you won't blow this deal just for the satisfaction of 
popping him. Please forgive me. 
Josh: I don't like where this is headed. 
Olivia: What do you mean? 
Josh: I don't trust Alan. I've been down this road with him before. It

always ends up in a head-on collision and somebody gets hurt. 
Phillip: My God. We thought you were dead. Where... Where have you 
been? You're acting like nothing has happened here. My God, you must have 
been through hell. 
Edmund: Yes, she has, and she obviously needs to rest right now. 
Phillip: We had a memorial for you. 
Edmund: Let's go. 
Phillip: We have been mourning you. 
Lorelei: I'm sorry. I... 
Phillip: Sorry? Oh, my God, not "sorry." You're alive. Thank 
God. I... 
Beth... 
Lorelei: I never thought that I would see you again, Phillip. 
Phillip: Oh, God. 
Gus: How can I help you? 
Harley: Aitoro, you've got to help me. The baby's coming. 
Gus: No, that's not a good idea. Listen, that's not a good idea. Just 
hold on 
tight. Squeeze your legs together, okay? I'm going to call the paramedics. 
Harley: But you can't leave me. Uh-oh. (Whimpering) 
Gus: How do you get yourself into these messes, can I ask you? You get

yourself arrested, thrown in jail for speeding. The guy gets himself knocked 
out, he loses the only key to the only cell he's got. You're about to drop a 
baby. How do these things happen to you? 
Harley: Would you shut up and do something, please? 
Gus: (Whistling) hey! 
Harley: Hey, there's the noon whistle. 
Rick: What's going on? 
Gus: Hey, Rick. 
Harley: This hurts. 
Rick: I could hear you guys screaming all the way across the parking 
lot. 
What are you... What are you doing in here? What's this guy doing? What's 
going on? 
Harley: I thought this would be a great place to have a baby. Don't you

think so? 
Rick: The baby's coming? All right. We've got to get you-- this is 
locked-
- we've got to get you to the hospital. 
Gus: Yeah, no kidding, "Dr. Quinn, medicine woman." Look, 
look, just 
find a key or something. And if you can't find a key, because I couldn't. Just

call a locksmith, Rick. 
Rick: Harley, how far apart at the contractions? 
Harley: I don't know, about a minute. Maybe a minute. 
Rick: Yeah, we don't have time for a locksmith. Put your hands out. 
Roll 
up your sleeves. Put your hands out. 
Gus: What? 
Rick: Roll up your sleeves and put your hands out. Do it now. 
Gus: Why? Why? 
Rick: Other hand. Roll up. We're going to sterilize your hands up to 
your 
elbows, and I'm going to give you some gloves. We're going to do the same 
things with these. Put them on. 
Gus: For what? 
Rick: You're going to play doctor. 
Gus: No, no. 
Harley: I don't think that's a good idea. 
Gus: I cannot tou... I haven't even... 
Rick: We're not going to argue about this now. Stop it. Aitoro, you're

going to be fine. You're going to be fine. I'm going to walk you through this

every step of the way. 
Gus: I can't do this. 
Rick: Yes, you can. Yes, you can. Put it on. Okay. All right. 
Gus: I'm not good at these types of gloves. 
Rick: All right, do not... Do not drop this on the floor. This is as 
sterile as 
we're going to get, okay? Walk over to her feet, good. Just walk over to her 
feet. We're going to use that to catch the baby. We're going to wrap him up, 
you're going to cut the umbilical cord. All right? First things first. 
Harley: My hands. 
Rick: First things first. I want you to tell me if you can spot his 
head. 
Harley: This is not a time to be shy, just look! 
Gus: Shut it. Shut it! Now you can start your screaming. Go ahead. 
Harley: (Moaning) 
Rick: Breathe, breathe, blow. Breathe, breathe, blow. Breathe, breathe,

blow. Good. Breathe, breathe, blow. Good, good, good, good. 
Gus: All right. Great, that's good. Loosen up on my hand a little bit; 
it's 
getting numb. 
Rick: Breathe, breathe, blow. 
Harley: Breathe, breathe, breathe. 
Rick: Breathe, breathe, blow. 
Gus: I'm not going to let you down. 
Rick: Breathe, breathe, blow. Breathe, breathe, blow.

[Commercial.]
Phillip: I want you to tell me... I want you to tell me everything that

happened from the time you disappeared in the plaza. Don't leave anything 
out. 
Edmund: No, not tonight. She needs to rest. She can't relive this 
nightmare right now. 
Lorelei: No, no, no. That's okay, Phillip, you've been worried sick, 
right? 
I think it's the least that I can do. You know about the flash flood, hmm? 
Phillip: Edmund told me. 
Lorelei: Well, it was a doozy. It was a raging, torrent of dark, muddy

water full of dead animals and trees, and... Anyway, I grabbed onto a branch 
that was sticking out of the mud, and I held on for as long as I could until I

was able to pull myself up onto the bank. But I must have hit my head on a 
rock or something, because I blacked out. 
Edmund: Just God-awful. You shouldn't have to relive that. 
Phillip: So obviously you came to at some point? 
Lorelei: Yes. But I wasn't on the riverbank anymore. I was in a clinic 
run 
by missionaries and I was delirious. I just kept going in and out of 
consciousness and I don't know how long I was like that. 
Phillip: Did you have a doctor? 
Lorelei: Oh, yes, and they took such good care of me. I mean, and I 
didn't 
know who I was. I didn't know where I was from. I didn't have any 
identification on me. I feel that I should tell you, I still get memory lapses.

Phillip: Okay, because you... I mean, you're... Okay. But you do feel 
like 
most of your memory has come back? 
Lorelei: Oh, yeah. You know, one day it just happened to me, click, and 
I 
knew that I was Beth Raines Winslow of Springfield. And here I am. 
Edmund: (Exhales deeply) so that's the story. Well, let's go. 
Phillip: Why didn't you call? 
Lorelei: They didn't have any telephones. 
Phillip: Well, no, but I mean, when they had to take you someplace to 
get 
you home, they took you to an airport, I assume. Why didn't you just pick up 
a phone and let somebody know you were alive? 
Lorelei: Well, I guess I didn't think of it. I'm sorry. This must have 
been 
really hard on you, huh? 
Phillip: Oh, no, Beth, that's not the point. I just... 
Lorelei: Well, I mean that... What I'm really trying to say is the only 
thing 
I could really think about was getting home to my husband. 
Phillip: To him? 
Lorelei: Yeah. Yeah. I had a lot of time to think while I was in that 
clinic, 
and I realized that I love Edmund, and I want to be with him. 
Edmund: Oh, I love you too, darling. I love you, too. Now, let's get 
you 
someplace where you can be alone and safe. 
Phillip: No. Not so fast. 
Edmund: No, I think you've heard enough from the lady. 
Phillip: No, I heard plenty from the lady. I just don't think I believe 
any of 
it. 
Beau: Turn around! Who are you? 
Reva: Who are you? 
Beau: I believe I asked you first. Are you a spy for general butler?

Reva: Well, if I was, I wouldn't tell you. 
Beau: Did I scare you? 
Reva: No. 
Beau: Not at all? 
Reva: Is that your sword? 
Beau: No. It's my father's. When I go to war, I'll have one of my own.

Reva: You want to go to war? 
Beau: Of course. 
Reva: You look very handsome in your uniform. 
Beau: Thank you, ma'am. I just wish my father would feel the same way.

I got the uniform, but he won't sign me up. Beauregard Robechaux at your 
service. 
Reva: Beauregard? 
Beau: After the great general Pierre Beauregard. Oh, come on, everyone 
in 
new Orleans knows who he is. 
Reva: Do they? 
Beau: He fired the first shot at fort Sumter. You do know about fort

Sumter, don't you? 
Reva: Sure. 
Beau: General Beauregard's a hero. It's a very distinguished name. 
Reva: It's a mouthful. 
Beau: That it is. But you can call me Beau. I guess you're my daddy's

nurse. 
Reva: Yeah, I guess I am. 
Beau: Well, my father's a hero, too, you know. 
Reva: Really? 
Beau: Colonel Jack Robechaux of the famous fifth brigade. He got 
wounded in Vicksburg, but my mama says we're lucky he didn't wind up in 
one of the vermin-infested Yankee prison camps. Of course there's a 
gentlemen's agreement to exchange officers, but not that the Yankees are 
gentlemen. 
Reva: Regina is your mama? 
Beau: No, she's my stepmother. My real mother died when I was born. 
Daddy only married Regina a few years ago. 
Reva: I get the feeling you don't like her very much. 
Beau: I just don't like the fact that she brought the beast into our 
home. Do 
you know they say he steals people's spoons? 
Reva: The beast? 
Beau: General Mordacai Hudson? You know, it's bad enough new Orleans

was taken in the first year of the northern aggression, but now we're ruled by

the beast. But we all pray that the tide will turn soon, and we'll have them on

the run. 
Reva: Well, it could take a lot longer than that. 
Beau: Then I'll have a chance to fight. 
Reva: No, Shayne. 
Beau: Shayne? 
Reva: I mean, beau. 
Harley: I can't do it. 
Rick: Yes, you can. Yes, you can. 
Harley: I can't do it, I know I can't. 
Rick: Yes, you can. 
Harley: No, I quit. 
Gus: No, I quit. If you quit, I quit. Rick, I quit. I quit. 
Rick: What do you mean? 
Gus: You can do it on your own. Want to do it on your own? Do it on 
your own. 
Harley: Gus, you can't quit. If you quit, the baby's going to fall on 
the 
floor. (Laughs nervously) don't make me laugh, Aitoro, just that the baby's 
coming. 
Gus: Hold my hand. 
Rick: Don't push. 
Gus: Focus on my eyes instead. 
Rick: Aitoro... Aitoro, tell me what's happening. 
Harley: What's happening? 
Gus: I don't know. Something doesn't look right. It doesn't really look

like a baby's face. It looks like a butt or some legs. 
Rick: Oh, it's breech. 
Harley: Oh, no. 
Rick: Perfect. 
Harley: No! 

[Commercial.]
Phillip: I'm not sure she 
Edmund: You just called Beth a liar. 
Phillip: I'm not sure she knows it's a lie. 
Lorelei: Huh? 
Edmund: Well, you obviously have insulted the woman, so I think it's 
time 
to go. 
Phillip: She would not have come back to you. 
Edmund: Well, obviously she did. 
Phillip: Not if what Gomez and Cruz said true. 
Edmund: Gomez and Cruz tried to rape her. 
Lorelei: It was horrible. It was really, really, really horrible. 
Phillip: You remember that? 
Lorelei: Yeah, mm-hmm. Yeah. Edmund was so heroic. 
Edmund: Don't... Don't... Don't think about it, darling. You're safe 
now. 
It doesn't matter about those thugs. It just matters that you're alive and well

here. 
Phillip: It doesn't make any sense. Why would Gomez and Cruz come 
looking for you? And how would they know about... 
Edmund: They work for the Sandovals. 
Phillip: The crime family here in Springfield? 
Edmund: That's right. Those people tried to get blood from a stone they

must think that I have money stashed somewhere, I don't know, but ask them 
and leave Beth out of it. She's been through enough. Come, darling, let me 
take you back to my room. 
Phillip: Beth... Beth, give me five minutes alone with you, please. 
Edmund: No, of course not, she's exhausted. 
Phillip: She can speak for herself. 
Lorelei: Five minutes? 
Phillip: Five minutes. 
Edmund: No five minutes. 
Lorelei: No. No, yourself. Phillip deserves that much for old time's 
sake. 
Hmm? 
Josh: Alan wants something, and I'm not talking about a return on his

investment in the harbor project; that's chump change for him. 
Olivia: Well, maybe it's... It's about power with Alan, you know that.

Maybe he just doesn't want to share the deal or maybe he feels like the low 
man on the totem pole. 
Josh: I know what this is. 
Olivia: What? 
Josh: He wants my company. He wants Lewis construction. He wants to 
steal it away the same way he did with Lewis oil. That's why he invested in 
the project, to put him inside my company. 
Olivia: Josh... 
Josh: I'm not going to let him do that I'm not going to let him take 
away 
this company from me. 
Olivia: Josh, he doesn't... 
Josh: I'm going to go over there and talk to him about it right now.

Olivia: No, no. It's about me! 
Josh: What? 
Olivia: Alan... Alan Spaulding wants me. 
Beau: You called me Shayne. 
Reva: Well, I sometimes mix up names. 
Beau: When I said I was going to go fight the Yankees, you said, 
"no, 
Shayne." 
Reva: You're so young. 
Beau: Excuse me, ma'am, but I do not think it is your place to tell me 
what 
I can and can't do. 
Reva: Excuse me, but you act as if war is something glamorous, and it's

not. War is hell. 
Beau: I've never heard a woman swear. 
Reva: Well, war is worth swearing about. People shouldn't kill each 
other; 
people shouldn't be killed. 
Beau: Of course you'd feel that way, being a nurse. But I am prepared 
to 
die for what is right. 
Reva: Well, I wish I could keep you young forever. 
Antoine: Madame. Madame. Where is she? This painting, it will never 
be finished. 
Beau: I'll go find her. This is my daddy's new nurse. Monsieur Cartier 
is a 
famous painter. 
Antoine: Oh. 
Beau: Ma'am. 
Antoine: I am not so famous as all that. Enchant‚. Your face, I would

love to paint. 
Reva: Really? You know, you've really captured her likeness. 
Antoine: I will be lucky to get half what it is worth. The times, they 
are 
bad. People have no pride. Their money, it all goes to the war. 
La guerre terrible. Ah, Madame. 
Regina: Antoine. My husband insisted on coming down to greet you, 
nurse Shayne. Jack? 
Jack: A pleasure, miss Shayne, but I fear your trip was for no reason. 
I do 
not require the services of a nurse. 
Regina: Jack, be reasonable. You almost lost your arm during battle. 
The 
doctor said it still runs a risk of infection. 
Jack: I can handle it myself. 
Regina: Please, just let her look at it. She's here anyway. 
Antoine: Madame. 
Regina: Oh, Antoine, I'm sorry, we have to postpone our sitting. 
Antoine: Again? 
Regina: I can't be helped, my husband's care is more important. I'm 
sorry. 
Jack: At this rate, that portrait will never be finished. I want to 
hang it 
over the mantle so my friends can envy me, my beautiful wife. 
Regina: Once you've healed, they better envy you than a picture. Why?

Why can't our lives go back to the way it was before the war? 
Jack: I'm not sure if things will ever be the same again, my love. 
Regina: We'll see about that. 
Jack: Is that why you invited general Hudson for dinner? 
Regina: We can stand the beast for one night if it will improve our 
circumstances. 
Jack: I don't like it. 
Regina: Neither do I. But the northern Huns occupy new Orleans, we have

to think about the future, and not just ours, but beau's. If we lose this 
plantation, he'll have nothing. 
Jack: He will still have his honor. 
Regina: Jack, we don't have to like the man. 
Jack: And I don't have to like entertaining him either. 
Regina: We'll make faces behind his back and serve him tepid soup. 
Jack: This is not a laughing matter, Regina. They have killed many of 
our 
finest and bravest young men. 
Regina: You're not saying you think we should surrender? 
Jack: Never. 
Regina: Good. That's why we need you healthy and strong. I'll leave you

to your nurse. Treat him as you would your own husband. 
Reva: I will. 
Josh: What exactly do you mean when you say he wants you? 
Olivia: I guess I should be flattered, you know, he keeps showering me

with compliments about how I managed to get the harbor project back on 
track after the earthquake. He seems to think I'm an essential part of Lewis 
construction. 
Josh: You are. You're essential to me, too. 
Olivia: He made a point of my loyalty to you during that whole phony

bribery scandal. It impressed him. 
Josh: It impressed me. 
Olivia: Anyway, you know, hard work, loyalty, success seemed to be an

intriguing combination to Alan. And what Alan wants, Alan seems to think 
he's going to get. 
Josh: What does he want? 
Olivia: He just wants to hire me. Just to hire me. He wants to make me 
a 
part of the Spaulding team. 
Josh: (Laughs) what? Oh, my. 
Olivia: You think this is funny? 
Josh: What? Yes, I think it's... Yes, I think it's funny. Yeah, he 
may... 
He may want you, but he's certainly not going to have you. 
Olivia: Those were my words exactly. 
Josh: Oh. Oh. 
Olivia: Can't we just get 
CBS news special report.
Dan Rather reporting from CBS news world headquarters in New York. 
U.S. Attorney General John Ashcroft was back before the microphones and 
television cameras. We go live to his briefing. 
Jack: You have a gentle touch. 
Reva: Years of practice. Years. 
Harley: Rick, look at our baby boy. He's so beautiful. 
Rick: He's breathing good. 
Harley: Thank you. 
Rick: Oh, thank you. You did a great job. 
Harley: Thank you, Aitoro. 
Rick: Thanks, Gus. Look at his coloring. 
Harley: Pink and perfect. 
Rick: He's beautiful. 
Gus: He's uh... The kid's got ten fingers and ten toes, I counted them 
to 
make sure. 
Rick: You did great, way to go. (Laughter) I can't believe it, a son.
